intro: Hieracium murorum subsp. habromorphum, commonly known as the creeping hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its clustered, yellowish flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and meadows. It has alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its botanical features make it identifiable and ecologically significant in its native range.
